Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD erred in determining extortion is not a Convention ground and whether an internal flight alternative (IFA) existed
Evidence_Type: Missing evidence on IFA, lack of detailed personal circumstances
Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 72, two-pronged test for IFA
Evaluation_Standard: Correct characterization of facts, thorough IFA analysis
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Mischaracterization of claim as extortion rather than torture, incomplete IFA analysis
Application_Error: Mischaracterization of claim, failure to properly assess IFA
Review_Outcome: Application allowed, case remanded to RPD for reevaluation by a different panel
Evidence_Ignored: Personal circumstances, lack of evidence on safety of IFA location
Legal_Standard: Existence of internal flight alternative, correct legal characterization
Application_Factor: Nature of harm (torture vs. extortion), feasibility of IFA
Decision_Review_Issue: Error in law and fact regarding Convention grounds and IFA
Cause_of_Refusal: RPD mischaracterized claim and conducted incomplete IFA analysis
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence considered on IFA, lack of country condition details
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to fully consider applicant's circumstances
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging RPD's factual and legal errors
Procedural_Issue: Incomplete RPD analysis, need for reevaluation by new panel
Omission_Type: Failure to assess personal circumstances, incomplete IFA evaluation
